title: I got robbed of my first kernel contribution
dot: digraph G{node[shape=box, style=filled, fillcolor=lightblue, fontname="Helvetica", fontsize=12]edge[fontname="Helvetica", fontsize=10]rankdir=LR Root[label="Main Issue: gdbserver couldn't debug multithreaded applications on PowerPC32"]subgraph cluster1{label="Investigation Process" style=dashed Breakthrough[label="Breakthrough: Found email thread and exact commit with bug"]Debugging[label="Debugging: Use pahole, ftrace to identify issue"]MemoryCorruption[label="Memory Corruption: Identified with hardware breakpoint"]}subgraph cluster2{label="Finding the Bug" style=dotted BufferOverflow[label="Bug Found: Buffer overflow in ptrace_put_fpr"]OverflowCause[label="Cause: Wrong array indexing in FPR"]}subgraph cluster3{label="Patch Submission" style=dotted PatchSent[label="Patch Sent to Linux Kernel Security Team"]PatchRejected[label="Patch Rejected by Maintainer"]PatchOwnFix[label="Maintainer Implements Own Fix"]}subgraph cluster4{label="Recognition Issue" style=dotted NoCredit[label="No Credit: Only 'Reported-by' tag given"]Frustration[label="Frustration: Maintainer disregards my fix"]Apology[label="Apology: Maintainer acknowledges mistake"]}Root->Breakthrough Root->Debugging Root->MemoryCorruption Breakthrough->Debugging Debugging->MemoryCorruption MemoryCorruption->BufferOverflow BufferOverflow->OverflowCause Root->PatchSent PatchSent->PatchRejected PatchRejected->PatchOwnFix PatchSent->NoCredit NoCredit->Frustration Frustration->Apology}

title: The most copied StackOverflow snippet of all time is flawed (2019)
dot: digraph StackOverflowSnippet{rankdir=TB;node[shape=box, style=rounded, fontname="Arial", fontsize=10];edge[fontname="Arial", fontsize=10];A[label="Andreas Lundblad's Answer on Stack Overflow (2010)"];B[label="Most Copied Snippet on Stack Overflow (2018)"];C[label="Bug in the Code Snippet"];D[label="Study on Attribution by Sebastian Baltes (2018)"];E[label="Fixing the Bug"];F[label="Final Version of the Code"];G[label="Key Takeaways"];A->B[label="Became the most copied snippet"];B->C[label="Ironically, it was buggy"];B->D[label="Included in a study on attribution"];C->E[label="Identified and fixed"];E->F[label="Final version with all fixes"];F->G[label="Lessons learned from the experience"];subgraph cluster_bug{label="Bug Details";style=dotted;C->"Lots of 9's Issue"[label="Identified"];C->"Even More 9's Issue"[label="Identified"];C->"Negative Input Issue"[label="Identified"];}subgraph cluster_study{label="Study Details";style=dotted;D->"No proper attribution in most cases"[label="Result"];D->"OpenJDK Repository Issue"[label="Highlighted"];}subgraph cluster_final{label="Final Version Details";style=dotted;F->"Golfed and compacted"[label="Stylistic choice"];F->"Handles all edge cases"[label="Functionality"];}subgraph cluster_takeaways{label="Key Takeaways";style=dotted;G->"Stack Overflow snippets can be buggy"[label="Lesson 1"];G->"Test all edge cases"[label="Lesson 2"];G->"Floating-point arithmetic is hard"[label="Lesson 3"];G->"Include proper attribution"[label="Lesson 4"];}}
